Therefore, the sarcastic statement is (B).

Statement (A) "Anyone can be successful without inheriting all their money first" implies that success is possible without relying on inherited wealth. This statement is not sarcastic because it is a realistic and positive statement.
On the other hand, statement (B) "Nobody can be successful without inheriting all their money first" is sarcastic because it implies that inherited wealth is a necessary condition for success, which is not a realistic or positive statement. It is a tongue-in-cheek statement that is meant to be ironic or mocking.
Therefore, the sarcastic statement is (B) "Nobody can be successful without inheriting all their money first."
